metadata.Title: CVE-2014-3507 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Memory leak in d1_both.c in the DTLS implementation in OpenSSL 0.9.8 before 0.9.8zb, 1.0.0 before 1.0.0n, and 1.0.1 before 1.0.1i allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (memory consumption) via zero-length DTLS fragments that trigger improper handling of the return value of a certain insert function.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-3507` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libssl1.0.0 - 1.0.1f-1ubuntu7
openssl - 1.0.1f-1ubuntu7
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

notes.Note: mdeslaur> openssl in lucid doesn't seem vulnerable, as code is different

criterions.comment: openssl package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.0.1f-1ubuntu7').
